Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 08:34PM jlong719 wrote: hi, I was diagonosed last August with DCIS after microcalcifications showed up in my mammogram.  I had a sterotactic and surgical biopsy, both positive for DCIS.  I had a mastectomy in November and my sentinel lymph node had some cancer cells which scared the living daylights out of me!  I had lymph nodes removed from my underarm in November and they did not have any cancer cells - oh my gosh, what a relief!   My last reconstruction surgery was April 10 and now I'm on Arimidex once a day for 5 years.  Please listen to your surgeon and do what is recommended as soon as possible to prevent this getting any further.  I did not do radiation or chemo due to the mastectomy which sounds worse than it is.  My broken arm hurt a lot more than my mastectomy.

Posts.Content: May 15, 2009 11:07PM jlong719 wrote: please get a second opinion - if it is something serious the sooner you take care of it the better.  It's really scary to think of the possibilities but be brave and face it.  My microcalcifications were early stage cancer and I had a mastectomy last November.  My sentinel lymph node had a few cancer cells but my underarm lymph nodes did not.  I wonder if the cancer cells would have gone into my lymph system and into my body if I had not had the mastectomy - I hate to think how much worse my diagnosis could have been.   Best of luck to you.
